about_the_game:
MURICA is a Metroidvania style 2D platformer taking place in an alternate version of the United States 2000 years in the future. As a player, you will get the once-in-a-lifetime opportunity to visit the utopia of MURICA! While you're there you'll learn new skills, discover powerful items and make new friends.

In one simple sweep of Deus Ex Machina, you'll be traversing the Great Wall of MURICA! Known not only for its majestic heights but also for the bustling, city-like infrastructure housed in its interior. From there, travel by luxury coach, air, or extradimensional tunnel (MURICA takes no responsibility for new timelines created via extradimensional tunneling) to any number of exotic destinations. Consider the Great Wall of MURICA your hub to a world of adventure!

  • Who says MURICA isn't green? Visit the Overgrowth located in the Great Lakes alkali flats; don't forget to take a wade in the nitrate pools while you're there!
  • Want to see the lights? Come see the largest autonomous dumpster fire in the world in beautiful downtown St. Louis!
  • Feeling lucky? Put it to the test and try a bit of gambling at the Wall Street Casino located in New York City!

KEY FEATURES

  • Death: Visit the Respawn Marketplace and decide how your deaths and respawns are handled! Choose lives, respawn points, or something else! (We're mostly sure you'll be able to afford it.) Each has its own perks and trade-offs.
  • Exploration: A rich, original pixel art world to explore with unique locations and varied backdrops. Each area has a distinct feel and aesthetic. You'll discover new paths and rediscover old ones as you acquire new items and abilities.
  • Story: An epic and powerful plot that speaks on the uncertainty of the future and the frailty of the human condition; best described as 'Idiocracy' meets 'Chrono Trigger' on 'some sort of drugs'.
  • Guns and stuff: Riot-shields and swords too. Because MURICA.
  • Start a religion: You know you've wanted to...

short_description: Get portal-napped to an alternate version of The United States 2000 years in the future. Travel the 16-bit landscape of MURICA on a search for the way home; and maybe save the past while you're at it.
